thread.title: Tata Steel shares fall on weak industry outlook
thread.title_full: Tata Steel shares fall on weak industry outlook | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Tata Steel shares fall on weak industry outlook
text:
Other Articles SKS Micro shares gain nearly 3% as Q1 net surges Wipro shares drop nearly 1% ahead of Q1 Lupin shares slide down 5%; Q1 results show 15.96% dip in its net profit Shares of Tata Steel fell by 2.9 per cent on Thursday after World Steel Association continued to guide for weaker global steel consumption growth. The company’s shares were down 31.8 per cent year to date.
At 10.55, Tata Steel shares were trading down 2.89 per cent on BSE at a price of Rs 272.25. On NSE, the shares were down 2.82 per cent down at Rs 272.50.
The stocks may head towards its lowest close since Sept. 2013
Weak sector outlook continued to weigh on the stock. Global crude steel output fell 2 per cent in the first half of the year, mainly due to continued weakness in top producer China and elsewhere in Asia.
Eurofer says European economic growth is expected to power only a 1.5 per cent rise in EU steel demand this year.
With agency inputs
 23, 2015 11:04 am © The Indian Express Online Media Pvt Ltd
